channel.title: My server compiler doesn't work..?
channel.description:
Hi, I'm looking for help here.
I think I screwed up my compiler, it was working fine last night, when I changed the code in the Client.java, ran the compiler file, it updated on the server, but I tried editing stuff today and no matter what I do to the client.java, nothing edits on the server. I'm assuming its a compiler error, so I would like someone to C+P what they have in their compiler, and I could replace mine?
Alternativly, I would be happy of any other explanations as to why this is happening. I'm kinda new to all this server development :P
thanks
Wetton

item.title: My server compiler doesn't work..?

@RSC_n33b wrote:

go to
line 36144
and remove that arrow , → that thing
then it will work

item.title: My server compiler doesn't work..?
item.dc:creator: @uber_leet uber leet
item.description:
@uber_leet wrote:

lol sure. Okay so I guess that you downloaded a source to begin with, like test scape or something?

Open up those files you downloaded, and have a look for Compiler. Right click that file, and go on edit.

inside that edit the code that is there, delete it all and replace it with:

@echo off
title Project Delting COMPILER
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

After you have done that, you need to know what version of java you have. If you have a mini-icon of java near the digital clock on the bottom of your screen, right click the java icon and choose ‘Open control panel’

From there go to view the information about your java version.

Now go back into edit in the compiler,

find the

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java

line. When you have found that line, replace jdk1.6.0_07 with whatever version you have, which is likely to be jdk.1.6.0_02, in which case your compiler cosde should read:

@echo off
title Project Delting COMPILER
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_02\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

Hope thats helped, if not message back
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 12, 2008, 09:18:31 AM[/size][hr]Thats right, yeah

If it doesn’t work then you’ll have to look through your client.java file, you may have an extra cracket that shouldn’t be there, most likely at the end… look for an extra }

If that still doesnt work I dunno what to suggest, I’ve done all I can

Read full topic

I’ll be sure to make a backup copy this time

Anyway Pk3r, try this

@echo off
title Project Delting COMPILER
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
pause

but vhange JDK type to whatever version you chave (Can be found in your java control panel)
